page.title: 02HITCHIN MARKET (1)
page.content: Hitchin Market, in its present form, has been established for at least ten years.Earliest records date from the thirteenth century.At this time it was a collection of moveable stalls for the buying and selling of perishable goods.Gradually the stalls became fixed and gave way to small shops between Bucklersbury and Sun Street,the market becoming established in the open area, still known as Market Place, near the streets. In 1794 The Universal British Directory states that Hitchin Corn Market was particularly noted for the quality and quantity of its wheat. By 1813 the most important aspect was the plait market, which supplied the Luton hat industries. In 1939 the market moved from Market Place to St. Mary's Square.
